entry.title: New Season, New Features: SAP Business One Localized Demo Databases Upgrade Now Available!
entry.content:
We are excited to announce that the SAP Business One localized demo databases have been upgraded to the latest release, 10.0 FP 2502, and are now available for download.

In addition to the upgraded databases, we have included recent transactional data to ensure your demos look fresh and organized!

These localized demo databases feature a pre-configured SAP Business One environment across 39 localizations. They are based on the model company, OEC Computers, and are available for both the MS SQL and SAP HANA versions of SAP Business One. 

Demonstrate, learn, teach, and test SAP Business One with a refreshed demo environment!

 

Download the Localized Demo Databases for SAP Business One

entry.title: Three new courses for SAP Business One, Web Client are now live on learning.sap.com
entry.content:
This public training, featuring a mix of video tutorials and practical examples, covers comprehensive aspects of the Web client through three distinct courses: 

  • Discovering SAP Business One, Web Client Logistics (TB2000) ‚Äì learn how to use and personalize the Web client, manage master data and activities, handle the sales and procurement processes, and monitor Inventory Transactions 
  • Utilizing SAP Business One, Web Client Accounting (TB2300)- explore, create, and manage various types of journal entries, use journal entry templates and recurring entries, and review and customize the chart of accounts to fit organizational needs. 
  • Implementing Customization Tools and Analytics in SAP Business One, Web Client (TB2900)- integrate Microsoft applications with the Web client, customize user-defined elements (UDF, UDT, UDO and UDV) to tailor the Web client environment to your specific needs. Also, leverage the Web client powerful analytics to enhance visibility on the business performance. 

Pass all the quizzes in each course and receive digital badges to share in social media. 

The three courses are available in 8 languages!

 

Questions we received from users and might be useful to the entire community: 

1) Q: I am a consultant working for an SAP Business One partner. Is this training relevant to me? 

A: Yes indeed. The training is at a beginner level for business users and consultants. 

2) Q: I am interested in learning about the Web client but I am not a customer or a partner. Can I take the training too?  

A: Anyone can take these public courses free of charge. If you like to track your progress, complete quizzes and earn a public badge you would also need to register. 

3) Q: What is the difference between these courses and the 'Exploring SAP Business One, Web Client'  learning journey? 

A: With all the great content in FP 2502, the ‚ÄòExploring SAP Business One, Web Client' learning journey was getting too big, so it was split into these three new courses.  

4) Q: I have bookmarked the Exploring SAP Business One, Web Client learning journey. Will this link work? 

A: Yes it will. The URL of the Exploring SAP Business One, Web Client learning journey is now redirected to the Discovering SAP Business One, Web Client Logistics course. 

Check out the SAP Business One landing page on learning.sap.com to explore the latest learning journeys and courses. 

Join our SAP Business One, Web client experts community today!

entry.title: Solved - How to join QUT1 and QUT10 tables?
entry.content:
Hoje eu e um amigo conseguimos finalmente resolver o caso da querie entre as tabelas QUT10 e a QUT1. No passado a conex√£o entre elas deveria ser o LineNum, nas novas vers√µes do SAP o AftLineNum da QUT10 passou a indicar o VisOrder da QUT1 e n√£o o pr√≥prio LineNum , no futuro at√© deveriam renomea-l√° para AftVisOrder.

Today, a friend and I finally managed to solve the query issue between the QUT10 and QUT1 tables. In the past, the connection between them was supposed to be LineNum. However, in newer SAP versions, the AftLineNum in QUT10 started pointing to the VisOrder of QUT1, and not LineNum itself. In the future, they should even consider renaming it to AftVisOrder.

SQL Code

SELECT
T1."DocEntry",
'Item' AS "LineType",
T1."VisOrder",
T1."ItemCode",
T1."Dscription",
T1."Quantity",
T1."Price"
FROM QUT1 T1
WHERE T1."DocEntry" = 652
    
UNION ALL

SELECT
T2."DocEntry",
'Text' AS "LineType", 
-- Apesar de ter Line no nome, na realidade ele √© a conex√£o com o campo "VisOrder" da tabela QUT1. Este campo deveria ter o nome de "AftVisOrder"
-- Despite having "Line" in its name, it actually serves as the connection to the "VisOrder" field in the QUT1 table. This field should really be named "AftVisOrder"
CASE WHEN T2."AftLineNum" = -1 THEN -1 ELSE T2."AftLineNum" + 0.5 END AS "VisOrder",
NULL AS "ItemCode",
T2."LineText" AS "Dscription",
NULL AS "Quantity",
NULL AS "Price"
FROM QUT10 T2
WHERE T2."DocEntry" = 652

ORDER BY "VisOrder"

Visual SAP

Querie Result

Rgs

Fabio

SAP 10 FP2505 (PL19) / SQL2022

entry.title: üöÄ What‚Äôs New in Cloud Control Center PL21 ‚Äì Smarter, Safer, and More in Control
entry.content:
Cloud Control Center PL 21

üìÖReleased: June 23, 2025

üìçTarget audience: SAP Business One Partners, Cloud Operators, SAP Business One cloud customers and SAP Business One fan base in general.üòé

Last week we launched SAP Business One Cloud 1.1 Patch Level 21 (PL21) ‚Äî and if you‚Äôre using Cloud Control Center (CCC) to manage your SAP Business One Cloud landscape, this update is worth your attention.

PL21 is packed with enhancements focused on security, visibility, automation, and flexibility.

üëâ In this post, I've rounded up 12 of the most impactful and attractive highlights ‚Äî the ones i believe will make the biggest difference in your day-to-day operations.

Here‚Äôs a quick walk-through of what‚Äôs new üëá

 

üîêCertificate Expiration ‚Äì Now Fully Visible

No more surprises!

The CCC home page now displays certificate expiration dates for your key components (License Servers, Service Layers, Job Services, etc.).

‚ú®Bonus:

An automatic scan is triggered when CCC starts. You‚Äôll get a warning if a certificate is expired or due to expire within the next 30 days ‚Äî and yes, this can be toggled off in global settings if needed.

 

üîçSee SLD Agent Versions at a Glance

You asked, we delivered ‚Äî SLD Agent version info is now shown in the component details. Easier troubleshooting, less back-and-forth.

üßπ CCC Cleans Up After Itself

Every time you open CCC, it automatically removes logical machine logs older than 6 months.

You can also now remove unused logical machines more easily:

  • If the SLD Agent status is unreachable
  • If no SLD Agent is installed, just restart the SLD service to clean it up.

üîêDynamic Key Encryption ‚Äì Now Available for Tenants

Dynamic Key encryption can now be activated for tenants directly in CCC.
Strengthen your security posture without hassle.

 

‚ö†Ô∏èUAP/CCC Version Mismatch Warning

If there‚Äôs a version mismatch between User Access Portal (UAP) and CCC, you‚Äôll now see a clear warning.

A small heads-up that could save you from bigger issues.

 

‚¨ÜÔ∏èEnforce Tenant Upgrades via Staging Units

A new global setting now lets you restrict tenant upgrades to staging service units only.

This adds a layer of control that‚Äôs especially useful in multi-tenant environments.

 

üìäAnalytics Services Initialization During Upgrade

When duplicating or upgrading tenants on SAP HANA service units, a new checkbox lets you automatically initialize the tenant in Analytics Services.

‚úÖLess manual setup

‚úÖFaster analytics availability

 

üîêCertificate Verification Built-In

Whether you‚Äôre installing CCC, UAP, or Tenant Configurator, new steps in the wizard ensure you only proceed with valid certificates in place. It‚Äôs a simple but vital enhancement.

 

üíæAutomatic B1AS Backup During Upgrade

During upgrades of CCC, a new wizard step now backs up the Authentication Service database (B1AS) ‚Äî just in case. üôå

 

üìàHigh Availability Setup ‚Äì Now Streamlined

We‚Äôve made it easier to set up HA for your B1 Cloud components:

  • Simpler nginx reverse proxy installation
  • Updated SLD HA config files
  • No need to choose Admin/Worker mode during install ‚Äî all nodes are now equal

Less complexity. More flexibility.

 

üë•Operator Access with Boundaries

Need to involve someone in SAP Business One implementation without authorization to change CCC settings?

You can now assign the ‚ÄúRead-Only and Open PSU Connection‚Äù role ‚Äî perfect for implementation experts who need access to the product but shouldn‚Äôt change cloud settings.

üÜïOne More Thing‚Ä¶

SAP Business One Cloud 1.1 PL21 now officially supports Microsoft SQL Server 2022.

That‚Äôs one more way we‚Äôre keeping your platform options open.

üí¨Your Feedback Matters

We invite you to try out the new features in Cloud Control Center PL21 and tell us what you think!

What‚Äôs working well? What would you love to see next?

üëáDrop your thoughts in the comments ‚Äî we‚Äôre always listening.

entry.title: Custom Sales Blocklist in SAP Business One
entry.content:
Abstract

How can we block specific items for certain customers in SAP Business One? Unchecking the "Saleable" field in the Item Master Data will block the item for all customers, but what if we want to give clients the option to choose which items are not saleable for each customer during a specific period? The solution is to define a Sales Blocklist table in the system and use an SQL stored procedure to prevent sales forms from recording restricted data.

Steps

  1. User-Defined Tables ‚Äì Setup
  2. User-Defined Fields ‚Äì Management
  3. Modifying Stored Procedure in the Database
  4. Filling Out the Designated Table
  5. Sales Documents

1.  User-Defined Tables ‚Äì Setup

To create tables in SAP Business One, follow this path and create the Sales Blocklist table:

Tools ‚Üí Customization Tools ‚Üí User-Defined Tables ‚Äì Setup

üí°For an auto-generated numeric key, set Object Type to No Object with Auto Increment; this automatically fills the Code column. Moreover, there would be no risk of duplicate keys and no need for custom numbering logic.

2.  User-Defined Fields ‚Äì Management

To create columns in the User-Defined Fields Management form:

Tools ‚Üí Customization Tools ‚Üí User-Defined Fields ‚Äì Management

üí°After the table is saved, SAP Business One adds it to Tools ‚Üí User-Defined Windows.

3.  Modifying Stored Procedure in the Database

Modify SBO_SP_TransactionNotification in the selected database.

IF _type = '17' AND @transaction_type IN ('A', 'U') -- Sales Order 
BEGIN
    DECLARE @CardCode NVARCHAR(50), @DocDate DATE
    DECLARE @BlockedItems NVARCHAR(MAX) = ''

    SELECT @CardCode = CardCode, @DocDate = DocDate FROM ORDR WHERE DocEntry = _of_cols_val_tab_del

    SELECT @BlockedItems = STRING_AGG(T0.ItemCode, ', ')
    FROM RDR1 T0
    INNER JOIN [@SALESBLOCKLIST] T1 
      ON T1.U_CustomerCode = @CardCode  
      AND T1.U_ItemCode = T0.ItemCode
    WHERE T0.DocEntry = _of_cols_val_tab_del
      AND @DocDate BETWEEN T1.U_FromDate AND T1.U_ToDate

    IF @BlockedItems IS NOT NULL AND @BlockedItems <> ''
    BEGIN
        SET  = 1001
        SET _message = N'Selling these items to this customer on this date is not allowed: ' + @BlockedItems
    END
END

  The code above applies the blocklist logic to Sales Orders. For the complete script, which extends this validation to other documents like Deliveries and A/R Invoices, please see the full version on GitHub.

4.  Filling Out the Designated Table

Fill the table manually or by copying data from Excel spreadsheets. Open the created table from the menu and fill it up for the specific restrictions.

 

5.   Sales Documents

In the following step, use a Sales documents like Sales Order by selecting a specific customer and items.

Now, when we select items for the specific customer that is on the Sales Blocklist table, we will see an error that forbids the user from selecting these items.

Conclusion

This method is a useful way to restrict the sale of specific items to certain customers for a defined period of time in SAP Business One. For the blocking logic itself, several alternatives can also be very effective. These include using the B1 Usability Package (a third-party add-on) or adding a User-Defined Field (UDF) at the row level with a Formatted Search for real-time validation. Additionally, for managing large volumes of restriction data, using the Data Transfer Workbench (DTW) for bulk uploads can be a useful tool for larger implementations.

 

Prepared by

Amirhossein Tonekaboni

SAP Business One ERP Consultant

  •   GitHub
  •   Linkedin
  •   Allmylinks

entry.title: Supercharge your view of Connected Business Partners
entry.content:
Introduction

It‚Äôs a common headache in SAP Business One: a company shows up in both ledgers‚Äîvendor and customer‚Äîand the net position isn‚Äôt obvious during day-to-day work. In SAP Business One, link the two records using the 'Connected Customer/Vendor' field in BP Master Data (Accounting) so the relationship is explicit in the system. Once the records are linked, the standard tools‚ÄîDunning, Aging, and Internal Reconciliation‚Äîbecome much more useful for seeing the combined relationship. The foundational aspects of handling these dual-role scenarios are valuable topics within the SAP Business One community. This article provides practical tips to enhance your control over these relationships.

In practice, most teams want faster, on‚Äëform visibility and safeguards. Here's what actually delivers that. This article delves into practical custom enhancements you can implement in SAP Business One. We'll cover how to empower users through:

  • Adding dynamic User-Defined Fields (UDFs) with live balance queries to critical forms like Outgoing Payments.
  • Implementing automated alerts to stay informed about key connected BP statuses.
  • Introducing transaction validations (via SBO_SP_TransactionNotification) to prevent issues, such as unnecessary payments to vendors who are also indebted to us as customers.

Connecting Business Partners

To link a customer and a vendor in SAP Business One, you can use the 'Connected Customer/Vendor' field within the accounting tab in Business Partner Master Data.

üí°    The [ConnBP] database field in the OCRD table (Business Partner Master Data table) stores this link, and connect two distinct BP records.

Connected Vendor/Customer field in BP Master Data


Standard SAP Business One Tools for Managing Connected BPs

1.    Dunning Wizard: This tool can be configured to consider the connected relationship, providing a comprehensive report for both the primary BP and its connected counterparts by selecting the relevant options in the Dunning Wizard.

Dunning Wizard for connected BPs

2.    Customer/Vendor Aging Reports: These reports can also display all related documents for connected business partners, offering a unified view.

Customer/Vendor Aging Reports

3.    BP Internal Reconciliation: After reviewing the status of connected BPs (e.g., via Aging Reports or your custom query), the Internal Reconciliation feature can be used. While standard internal reconciliation typically applies to transactions within a single BP account, understanding the consolidated picture can guide manual journal entries or offsetting transactions that effectively reconcile the net position between a connected customer and vendor when submitting financial documents.

BP Internal Reconciliation

Internal Reconciliation

Going Beyond Standard Tools: Custom Enhancements for Superior Control

Beyond the built‚Äëin functions, a few small customizations can give you tighter control in daily business:

1.    Custom Queries for Real-time Tracking & Proactive Alerts: You can create specific SQL queries to get an immediate overview of these relationships. This query can then be added to a user's 'My Menu' for quick access.

SELECT
    V.CardCode,
    V.CardName,
    C.CardCode,
    C.CardName,
    C.Balance AS CustomerBalance,
    V.Balance * -1 AS VendorBalance,
    V.Balance + C.Balance AS NetBalance
FROM OCRD V
INNER JOIN OCRD C ON V.CardCode = C.ConnBP
WHERE V.CardType = 'S' AND C.CardType = 'C'
ORDER BY V.CardCode;

üîó    This query provides a real-time snapshot of vendor-customer balances, aiding decision-making. The full code is on GitHub.

Connected BP Balance Query
Set up the balance query as a scheduled Alert: if the connected customer is overdue beyond your limit and the vendor has a payment due, AP gets a notification.

Setting up alerts for connected BP balances

Messages/Alerts Overview

üí°   For scheduled alerts, ensure the SAP Business One Job Service (Alerts) component is installed and running on your server, and that Alert Management is enabled in General Settings.

2.    Implementing Transaction Validations via Stored Procedure

To prevent potential issues, such as making a large payment to a vendor who, as a connected customer, has a significant overdue balance, you can implement validations directly within SAP Business One transactions.

You can do this by adding a rule in the SBO_SP_TransactionNotification stored procedure: when an Outgoing Payment is added for a vendor, check the connected customer's overdue balance and block it if it's over your set limit. For example, when an Outgoing Payment is being added for a vendor, your stored procedure can check if this vendor has a connected customer account with an overdue balance. Based on predefined conditions (e.g., if the customer's overdue amount exceeds a certain threshold), the procedure can block the payment and display an error message to the user, prompting them to review the consolidated account status before proceeding.

üîó    This way, you avoid paying a supplier who is overdue as a customer. The complete stored procedure is available on GitHub.

Validations via Stored Procedure

3.    User-Defined Fields (UDFs) for Instant Visibility on Forms

Add UDFs on Outgoing Payments and drive them with Formatted Searches so that when a vendor is picked, the connected customer code and both balances appear instantly. When a vendor is selected, these UDFs can automatically display the code of any connected customer and their relevant balances.

Used-Defined Fields - Management

When a vendor is selected on the Outgoing Payment form, if they have a customer linked using the 'Connected Customer' field (in BP Master Data), the UDF for 'Connected BP Code' will auto-populate. Subsequently, other UDFs can display the connected customer's balance and the main vendor's balance using Formatted Searches linked to custom SQL queries.

Outgoing Payments form with UDFs for a linked customer

These UDFs use the Formatted Search feature to automatically fetch and display relevant data via linked SQL queries.

üí°    To assign a Formatted Search to a UDF (or any field), select the field on the form and press 'Alt + Shift + F2'  to open the 'User-Defined Values - Setup' window.

Used-Defined Values

If no customer is connected to the selected vendor, the 'Connected BP Code' UDF will be empty, and the 'Customer Balance' UDF will display zero.

Outgoing Payments Form for a Vendor with No Linked Customer


Conclusion

Adding a few well‚Äëchosen UDFs, a targeted alert, and one or two validation rules can make SAP Business One much easier to use when a vendor is also a customer‚Äîgiving your team a clearer view, more control, and fewer mistakes.

 

Prepared by

Amirhossein Tonekaboni
SAP Business One ERP Consultant

  • GitHub
  • LinkedIn
  • Allmylinks

SAP and SAP Business One are trademarks of SAP SE. This article is an independent publication by the author and not an official SAP statement.

entry.title: Data Exports from SAP Business One for migration to Cloud ERP
entry.content:
When working with SAP Business One (SBO) and you need to integrate with other systems, for example integration flows. We need to have accurate data when exporting from SBO.
if you will use queries directly from HANA Studio or a MSSQL client you will not get the same format as we have in the SBO client. 

From my personal experience for optimal results and to avoid Malfunctions results, like NULL values and incorrect data formats. it's recommended to use the Query Generator in SAP Business One version for SAP HANA to extract the data. because the syntax is different for MSSQL, and can will be failed when running it on HANA.

Running your export queries within SBO ensures that the data is extracted in the format and structure that we have in SBO. reduces the chances of NULL Values instead of empty string. NULL Values can lead to unexpected data.

SBO handles data types and formatting (e.g., dates, numbers) in a specific way. Exporting directly from SBO ensures these formats are preserved.

To ensure that numeric values are parsed correctly in target systems. check that your thousands separator is a comma (,) (go to Administration -> System Initialization -> General setting - Display) and check your ‚ÄúThousands Sep‚Äù. This is a common requirement for many integration scenarios to ensure numeric values are parsed correctly in target systems.
To have the correct Data Formats, set your date format to yy/mm/yyyy (go to Administration -> System Initialization -> General setting - Display) and check your ‚ÄúDate Format". Consistent date formatting is critical for accurate date.

We can use in the Query Generator to see the related table by the one in bold and add it to the query by drag it to the table section.

and ensure that we use the Correct Joins, to have all the necessary records and avoid missing data.
Incorrect or missing JOIN clauses are a common reason for incomplete datasets.
Double-check the relationships between tables in your query.
You can change the JOIN in the Query Generator (INNER JOIN, LEFT JOIN, RIGHT JOIN, and FULL JOIN) and select the one that retrieves all desired records for your specific use case.

One more thing that it is important is the Field Types and Lengths. We need to check if the data is match to the data Field Types and Lengths in the corresponding target systems.

We can leverage the SDK Help to get the Field Types and Lengths and check if we need to convert the data accordingly. it's highly recommended to use the SAP Business One SDK Help. This resource provides information on:

  • Field Types: you need to check that the data types of SBO fields will helps you choose appropriate corresponding types in your target system, preventing data truncation or type mismatch errors.
  • Field Lengths: you need to check that the data maximum length of a field is match to your target systems, if not you will need to check if you can truncate it accordingly and avoiding data loss.
  • Valid and Default Values: you can check what are the Valid Values for a filed and can use it in the query if needed
  • Related Tables: you can see the related table for a filed and can use it for join in the query if needed.

By following these best practices, you can improve the quality and reliability of your data exports from SAP Business One.

entry.title: üöÄ What happens when FI, Logistics and Business One experts sit at one table?
entry.content:
A lot of laughter, some tough questions, and plenty of real project stories.

Last night‚Äôs SAP Stammtisch showed once again:
üëâ We don‚Äôt just talk about systems ‚Äì we share experiences, pain points and solutions.

Special thanks to Sabine Clemens for your sharp insights into the FI world ‚Äì with your depth and energy, any FI project can fly.
Big shout-out to our colleagues from Limassol Maxim Kulakov and Nizam Babayev for opening the B1 perspective ‚Äì great to learn from you and understand your processes.
And of course, thanks to Damla Toraman for making the evening smooth, fun, and interactive.

This is exactly why I love these sessions: we learn from each other, across modules, across backgrounds.

üí° Who‚Äôs in for the next round?

entry.title: Next-Level Demos: SAP Business One Localized Demo Databases are Updated and Available
entry.content:
We‚Äôre excited to share that the SAP Business One localized demo databases have been upgraded to the latest release, 10.0 FP 2508, and are now available for download!
This update includes fresh transactional data to ensure your demo environments look clean, current, and professional.

The localized demo databases offer a fully pre-configured SAP Business One setup across 39 localizations, based on the model company OEC Computers. They are available for both MS SQL and SAP HANA platforms.

Whether you're demonstrating, learning, teaching, or testing SAP Business One, this refreshed demo environment is designed to support your goals with greater clarity and realism.

Download the Localized Demo Databases for SAP Business One
